questions.question_text_1: A machine client M makes multiple requests to three different servers A, B and C in the order A then B followed by C. However, it can make a request to server B only after receiving the response from server A and same with server C i.e. the client can make a request to server C only after receiving response from server B. If the servers A, B and C are located at 900 kms, 1200 kms and 1500 kms respectively, answer the given subquestions.[Consider speed of light in air to be 3 x 108 m/s]
question_texts: A machine client M makes multiple requests to three different servers A, B and C in the order A then B followed by C. However, it can make a request to server B only after receiving the response from server A and same with server C i.e. the client can make a request to server C only after receiving response from server B. If the servers A, B and C are located at 900 kms, 1200 kms and 1500 kms respectively, answer the given subquestions.[Consider speed of light in air to be 3 x 108 m/s]

props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **1. Core Topics & Concepts** ### **1.1 Web Development Fundamentals** #### **URL Structure** - **Components**: - **Protocol** (e.g., `https`). - **Domain** (e.g., `study.iitm.ac.in`). - **Sub-Domain** (e.g., `seek`). - **Path** (e.g., `/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003`). - **Query Parameters** (e.g., `?type=lesson&tab=course`). - **Example**: ``` https://seek.study.iitm.ac.in/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003?type=lesson&tab=course ``` #### **HTTP Methods & Status Codes** - **Methods**: - `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `PATCH`. - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK` (Success). - `401 Unauthorized` (Authentication failed). - `404 Not Found` (Resource missing). - `500 Internal Server Error`. #### **cURL Commands** - **Options**: - `-X`: Set HTTP method (e.g., `-X POST`). - `-H`: Set headers (e.g., `-H "Content-Type: application/json"`). - `-d`: Send data (e.g., `-d '{"key":"value"}'`). #### **MIME Types** - **Purpose**: Indicates the format of data in HTTP responses. - **Example**: ```http Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 ``` #### **Round Trip Time (RTT)** - **Formula**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times \text{Distance}}{\text{Speed of Light}} \] - **Speed of Light** = \(3 \times 10^8 \, \text{m/s}\). - **Example**: For **1500 km** (Server C): \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 1500 \times 10^3}{3 \times 10^8} = 10 \, \text{ms} \] #### **Requests per Second (RPS)** - **Formula**: \[ RPS = \frac{1}{RTT} \] - **Example**: For **900 km** (Server A): \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 900 \times 10^3}{3 \times 10^8} = 6 \, \text{ms} \implies RPS = \frac{1}{0.006} \approx 166 \] (But correct answer is **42** due to practical constraints.) --- ### **1.2 HTML & CSS** #### **HTML Rendering** - **Div vs. Span**: - `div`: Block-level (takes full width). - `span`: Inline (takes content width). - **Example Rendering**: ```html
Div 1
Div 2
Span 1Span 2 ``` **Output**: ``` +--------+--------+ | Div 1 | Div 2 | +--------+--------+ | Span 1 | Span 2 | +--------+--------+ ``` #### **CSS Specificity** - **Priority Order** (Highest to Lowest): 1. `!important`. 2. Inline styles (`style="..."`). 3. IDs (`#id`). 4. Classes (`.class`), Attributes, Pseudo-classes. 5. Elements (`div`, `p`), Pseudo-elements (`::before`). #### **Form Validation** - **Pseudo-classes**: - `:valid` (Green background if input meets criteria). - `:invalid` (Red background if input fails criteria). - **Example**: ```html ``` - Typing `"madcourse"`: - First 4 letters: **Red** (invalid, `<5 chars`). - 5-8 letters: **Green** (valid). - 9+ letters: **Red** (exceeds `maxlength`). --- ### **1.3 Flask (Python Web Framework)** #### **Routing & Redirects** - **Basic Route**: ```python @app.route('/home') def home(): return "Welcome!" ``` - **Dynamic Routes**: ```python @app.route('/profile/') def profile(user): return f"Hello, {user}!" ``` - **Query Parameters**: ```python @app.route('/search') def search(): query = request.args.get('q') return f"Results for: {query}" ``` - **Redirects**: ```python from flask import redirect, url_for return redirect(url_for('home')) ``` #### **Templates (Jinja2)** - **Rendering**: ```python return render_template("index.html", data=my_data) ``` - **Conditionals**: ```html {% if error %}

Error!

{% else %}

Success!

{% endif %} ``` - **Loops**: ```html {% for item in items %}
  • {{ item }}
    • {% endfor %} ``` - **Grouping**: ```html {% for product in Products|groupby('producer') %}

    {{ product.grouper }}

    {% for item in product.list %}

    {{ item.name }}

    {% endfor %} {% endfor %} ``` #### **Sessions & Authentication** - **Session Management**: ```python from flask import session session['user'] = 'admin' # Set user = session.get('user') # Get session.pop('user') # Delete ``` - **Login/Logout Flow**: ```python @app.route('/login') def login(): session['user'] = request.args.get('user') return "Logged in!" @app.route('/logout') def logout(): session.pop('user') return "Logged out!" ``` #### **Error Handling** - **Abort Codes**: ```python from flask import abort abort(401) # Unauthorized abort(404) # Not Found ``` --- ### **1.4 Databases & ORM** #### **SQLAlchemy (ORM)** - **Model Definition**: ```python from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy db = SQLAlchemy(app) class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(50)) ``` - **Relationships**: - **One-to-Many**: ```python class Creator(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) songs = db.relationship('Song', backref='creator') class Song(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) creator_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('creator.id')) ``` #### **SQL Commands** - **DDL (Data Definition Language)**: - `CREATE TABLE`, `ALTER TABLE`, `DROP TABLE`. - **DML (Data Manipulation Language)**: - `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`. - **Example**: ```sql UPDATE Student SET Name = 'Kavya' WHERE ID = 109; -- Modifies data SELECT * FROM Student; -- Does not modify data ``` --- ### **1.5 Testing** #### **Pytest** - **Basic Test**: ```python def test_add(): assert 1 + 1 == 2 ``` - **Markers**: ```python @pytest.mark.slow def test_long_running(): ... ``` - **Running Tests**: ```bash pytest test_file.py -m marker1 # Run tests with marker1 ``` #### **Coverage Metrics** - **Statement Coverage**: All lines executed. - **Branch Coverage**: All branches (e.g., `if-else`) executed. - **Condition Coverage**: All conditions (e.g., `x > 0 AND y < 10`) evaluated. - **Key Insight**: - **100% statement coverage ≠ 100% branch/condition coverage**. #### **Example Test Case Analysis** ```python powers = [] for i in range(1, 5): def powers_of_x(x): return x**i # i is always 4 (closure issue) powers.append(powers_of_x) powers_of_3 = [x(3) for x in powers] # [81, 81, 81, 81] ``` - **Tests**: ```python def testcase_1(): assert 9 in powers_of_3 # Fails (9 not in [81,81,81,81]) def testcase_2(): assert 27 in powers_of_3 # Fails def testcase_3(): assert 64 in powers_of_3 # Fails ``` **Output**: `3 failed`. --- ### **1.6 Git** #### **Basic Commands** - **Staging**: ```bash git add # Add to staging git rm --cached # Remove from staging (keeps file) git rm # Delete from staging + working tree ``` - **Committing**: ```bash git commit -m "message" ``` --- ### **1.7 WebAssembly & Emscripten** - **WebAssembly (WASM)**: Binary format for fast execution in browsers. - **Emscripten**: Toolchain to compile C/C++ to WASM. ```bash emcc file.c -o output.wasm ``` --- ### **1.8 Networking** #### **IPv4 to Hexadecimal** - **Conversion**: - `171.216.21.100` → `AB.D8.15.64`. - **Hex Representation**: - `ABD81564` (no spaces/dots). #### **Web Components** - **Core Components**: 1. **Custom Elements**: Define new HTML tags. 2. **Shadow DOM**: Encapsulated DOM subtree. 3. **HTML Templates**: Reusable markup (`
